page.title: 09A KNOTTING FARMER (1)
page.content:
Mr. Parrish, who lives at Knotting in a 400 years old farmhouse, has two farms, this one and another in Dean. In all he has l400 acres of land, which are given over to mixed arable farming. Usually ll00 acres of wheat are grown, 200 acres of rape and l00 acres of grass, which are grazed by some sheep, horses and recently 7 Highland cattle, because Mr. Parrish feels that horses are poor grazers, but sheep and Highland cattle are like "lawnmowers".
In a good year, Mr. Parrish would expect to get 3 tons of wheat to the acre and one and a half tons of oil-seed rape to the acre. Last year he got Â£270 for each ton of rape, so he thinks this is a good cash crop.
